item.title: Getting parking policy right in the district
item.description: Feedback on a new joined-up approach to the implementation of Controlled Parking Zones (CPZs) across the district is being invited.

item.title: Scheme supporting those who need it most
item.description: An improved council tax reduction scheme which will further help working age, low-income households will come into effect in April.

item.description: Armed Forces Day in Folkestone, is now in its 14th year and is one of the largest one day shows in the area attracting more than 50,000 visitors. item.title: Have your say on local government reorganisation
item.description: Government ministers have launched a consultation on the future number of councils in Kent and Medway and the areas they should cover.

item.title: Council commitment to affordable homes continues
item.description: Six new homes are to be provided by the council in the rural village of Lyminge as part of a pledge to create more affordable, energy efficient homes in the district.

item.title: Cliff work before the fun can begin
item.description: The first major step towards an exciting new era for the Lower Leas Coastal Park play area in Folkestone will be taken next week.

item.title: Folkestone Remembers Holocaust Memorial Day 2026
item.description: On Tuesday 27 January 2026, a commemoration service was held in the Town of Folkestone to mark the annual Holocaust Memorial Day, an internationally recognised day to remember the millions of people who were murdered or whose lives were changed beyond recognition during the Holocaust, Nazi persecuti…

item.title: Help shape the district's future economic growth
item.description: A comprehensive strategy and action plan to support sustainable and inclusive economic growth across our district has been commissioned.

item.title: FTC Potential Purchase of the Grace Hill Building
item.description: Following a resolution by Folkestone Town Council at their meeting on 22 January 2026, a letter has been sent to Kent County Council setting out the strong local community interest in the potential purchase of the freehold of the Grace Hill Library building for a nominal sum.   Th…

item.title: Exciting next step for Folkestone regeneration
item.description: Work on a key aspect of a £20m project regenerating Folkestone town centre is to begin later this week.

item.title: Spectacular Anglo-Saxon Sword to go on display at Folkestone Museum
item.description: Finds from a top-secret Anglo-Saxon cemetery in East Kent, including a complete sixth century sword with silver-gilt hilt fittings, will go on display at Folkestone Museum in July 2026. This sword was featured on Digging for Britain last year. It is one of the finest Anglo-Saxon swords ever found in…

item.title: Change the tide with café opportunity
item.description: A new beachside destination at Greatstone is to be known as the Changing Tides Coastal Centre when it opens this year.

item.title: Positive steps forward for Folca
item.description: Significant progress continues to be made behind the scenes on the future of the Folca building in Sandgate Road that includes a new medical centre at its heart.

item.title: Future of swimming pools under spotlight
item.description: Financially supporting the re-opening of Folkestone Sports Centre pool and funding improvements to Hythe Pool are due to be discussed by councillors.

item.title: Recognition for a community of volunteers
item.description: Do you know a community hero who dedicates their own time and skills on behalf of others? Well, we want to hear about them.

item.title: Storm Goretti: Folkestone & Hythe update
item.description: Work is already underway to deal with the effects of Storm Goretti after the district’s coastline faced strong and forceful winds overnight.

item.title: Skill up your business for the new year and beyond
item.description: An exciting skills programme to strengthen the local economy and support small business growth across the district has been launched.

item.description: Funded by the Department for Work and Pensions on behalf of the UK government, the Household Support Fund scheme (HSF) supports vulnerable Kent households in need of help with significantly rising living costs. item.title: Taking a look at our financial future
item.description: Residents have the opportunity to comment on Folkestone & Hythe District Council’s budget strategy for 2026/27.

item.title: Councils send proposals for new councils to ministers
item.description: Proposals for the preferred number of new councils needed for Kent and Medway, and the geographical areas they should cover, have been submitted to the government today (Friday 28 November).

item.title: Why Local History Still Matters in a Modern Town

item.title: Developed my first film!
item.description: Always wanted to do that but the cost of buying all the quipment put me off. With Folkeshare I can hire the bits I need at very low cost and don’t have to store more stuff. They include everything needed apart from the chemistry. For that we have 2 camera shops near by.
